name: Enterprise Architecture CoE
description: An EA Center of Excellence in a large banking organization.

name: Architecture Governance
description: Establish and enforce architecture standards and policies.

name: Technology Assessment
description: Evaluate and recommend technologies aligned with business goals.

name: Roadmap Development
description: Create and maintain a strategic roadmap for architecture initiatives.

name: Stakeholder Engagement
description: Facilitate communication and collaboration among stakeholders.

name: Capability Maturity Assessment
description: Assess and improve the maturity of architectural practices.

name: Architecture Standards Management
description:
Establish, maintain, and govern architecture standards, reference architectures, and patterns to enable consistent design, interoperability, and reuse across programs within the Enterprise Architecture CoE.

Outcomes include standardized technology choices, faster delivery, reduced risk, and improved alignment with business strategy; success is measured by adoption of standards, conformance against reference architectures, and the number of architecture deviations that are closed.

**Inputs**
- Current architecture standards catalog
- Reference architectures and patterns library
- Change requests and project inputs
- Regulatory and security requirements as applicable

**Outputs**
- Updated standards catalog and reference architectures
- Standard-compliant architecture artifacts
- Conformance reports

**Stakeholders**
- Enterprise Architecture CoE
- Solution Architects
- Project Architects/Delivery teams
- Compliance and Risk

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Architecture repository / catalog tool
- Collaboration and review platform

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF
- ISO/IEC 42010
- ArchiMate

name: Policy Lifecycle and Enforcement
description:
Define, publish, review, and retire architecture policies; manage lifecycle to ensure policies reflect business needs, risk appetite, and regulatory changes.

Outcomes include policy clarity, consistent enforcement, auditable decisions, and timely policy updates across the organization.

**Inputs**
- Policy requests
- Regulatory changes
- Standards and current policies
- Stakeholder feedback

**Outputs**
- Architecture policies
- Policy backlog and planned revisions
- Enforcement plans and audit trails

**Stakeholders**
- Enterprise Architecture CoE
- Compliance/Risk
- PMO
- Legal (where applicable)

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Policy management tool
- Governance forums and workflow platforms

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF
- COBIT 2019
- ISO/IEC 27001 (where applicable)

name: Architecture Decision Governance
description:
Govern decision rights for architecture across programs; manage Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) including rationale, alternatives considered, and outcome; ensure traceability and reuse with alignment to standards and policies.

Outcomes include auditable decisions, faster approvals, and improved reuse of architectural rationale; key metrics include ADR coverage, time to decision, and decision quality.

**Inputs**
- ADR templates
- Architecture principles and standards
- Ongoing initiatives and project inputs
- Stakeholder inputs

**Outputs**
- ADRs and decision logs
- Approvals and rationale
- Decision-related communications

**Stakeholders**
- Architecture Review Board (ARB)
- Solution Architects
- Project sponsors
- Governance team

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- ADR tooling or repository
- Collaboration and documentation platform

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF ADM
- ISO/IEC 42010

name: Reference Architecture Portfolio & Reuse
description:
Develop and maintain reference architectures and patterns; promote reuse of proven designs to accelerate delivery and reduce duplication; manage a catalog aligned to business capabilities.

Outcomes include faster delivery, higher quality through reuse, and reduced duplication; metrics include reuse rate and time-to-deliver using reference architectures.

**Inputs**
- Reference architectures catalog
- Business capability maps
- Use-case patterns and precedent designs

**Outputs**
- Reference architecture artifacts
- Reuse guidelines and templates
- Updated reference catalog

**Stakeholders**
- Solution Architects
- Delivery teams
- Platform/Cloud teams
- IT Security

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Architecture repository / pattern library

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF
- ArchiMate

name: Compliance, Risk & Conformance Assurance
description:
Ensure architectures comply with standards and policies; perform risk assessments and conformance checks across programs; integrate with enterprise risk management and audits.

Outcomes include reduced risk and improved audit readiness; metrics include conformance rate and remediation cycle times.

**Inputs**
- Architecture standards and policies
- ADRs and design artifacts
- Audit findings and risk registers

**Outputs**
- Conformance reports
- Risk treatment plans
- Remediation backlog

**Stakeholders**
- Compliance/Risk
- Project teams
- QA/Testing
- IT Security

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Compliance scanning tools
- Policy enforcement and monitoring platforms

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- COBIT 2019
- ISO 27001

name: Exception & Deviation Management
description:
Establish and operate a controlled process for exceptions and deviations from standards; document rationale, assess risk, and maintain a Deviation Registry; ensure timely approvals and traceability.

Outcomes include controlled risk exposure, timely approvals, and auditable deviations; metrics include number of active exceptions and time-to-approve.

**Inputs**
- Exception/deviation requests
- Policy references and impact assessments
- Stakeholder inputs

**Outputs**
- Approved exceptions
- Deviation logs
- Mitigation actions

**Stakeholders**
- Architecture Review Board
- Project leads
- Risk & Compliance

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Workflow and case management tool

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF-based policy exception practices

name: Governance Data, Metrics & Continuous Improvement
description:
Collect governance data, define KPIs, and publish dashboards to diagnose performance and drive continuous improvement of architecture governance.

Outcomes include measurable governance, informed decision-making, and a prioritized improvement backlog; metrics include ADR coverage, policy adherence, and cycle times.

**Inputs**
- Governance data and process definitions
- Stakeholder feedback and strategic goals
- Existing dashboards and reports

**Outputs**
- Governance metrics dashboards
- Improvement backlog
- Lessons learned and best practices

**Stakeholders**
- EA leadership
- Portfolio/PMO
- Compliance/Risk
- Business sponsors

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Analytics platform / BI tools
- Data integration and governance tooling

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF measurement guidelines
- COBIT governance and metrics

name: Technology Landscape Monitoring
description:
Establish a formal, time-bound process to identify current and emerging technologies that could impact the organization's strategy and architecture. Capture signals from markets, vendors, and standards bodies to maintain a forward-looking technology view.

Produce a curated shortlist of technologies aligned to business priorities, with context for adoption, potential benefits, and risk; enable timely decision-making and updates to the Architecture Roadmap and Investment Plan.

**Inputs**
- Business goals and strategy documents to align scanning
- Current technology inventory and architecture standards
- Market intelligence sources (vendors, analysts, standards bodies)
- Regulatory and security constraints that influence technology choice
- Prioritized capability needs from business units

**Outputs**
- Technology landscape brief per period; curated shortlist of technologies with alignment rationale
- Recommendations for pilots or trials
- Updated technology taxonomy and landscape cadence

**Stakeholders**
- Enterprise Architecture CoE
- Strategy & Innovation
- CIO Office
- Security & Compliance
- Procurement
- Business Units

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Tech radar platforms and scanning tools
- Market intelligence feeds (analyst reports, vendor briefings)
- Collaboration and knowledge-sharing platforms

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF Technology Architecture guidance
- Alignment to NIST CSF and ISO 27001 where applicable

name: Technology Fit & Prioritization
description:
Assess alignment of shortlisted technologies with business goals and architectural principles; apply scoring criteria to compare options and generate a prioritized investment shortlist.

Deliver clear prioritization, highlighting trade-offs, risks, and benefits; provide inputs to the roadmap and funding decisions, with predefined success criteria and review points.

**Inputs**
- Business goals and strategic priorities
- Architecture standards and patterns
- Landscape shortlist and feasibility signals
- Evaluation criteria and initial cost considerations
- Budget and funding constraints

**Outputs**
- Prioritized technology shortlist
- Scoring rationale and decision criteria
- Investment recommendations and go/no-go points
- Stakeholder alignment notes

**Stakeholders**
- Strategy & Innovation
- CIO Office
- Architecture
- Finance
- PMO
- Business Units

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Scoring framework and decision matrix
- Value/risk heatmaps

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- COBIT for investment governance
- IT Investment Management (ITIM) guidance
- TOGAF alignment considerations

name: Technical Feasibility & Architecture Fit
description:
Evaluate the technical feasibility of each candidate against the target architecture, interoperability, data models, and non-functional requirements to ensure architectural coherence.

Deliver architecture fit reports and migration options that meet performance, scalability, security, and operational criteria while minimizing disruption.

**Inputs**
- Target architecture blueprint and principles
- Current system landscape and integration patterns
- Non-functional requirements (NFRs)
- Data considerations and governance constraints
- Interoperability and API standards

**Outputs**
- Feasibility assessment per option
- Architecture fit report with gaps and remediation options
- Migration and integration options

**Stakeholders**
- Solution Architects
- Enterprise Architecture
- IT Security
- Data & Integration teams
- IT Operations

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Architecture modeling tools and catalogs
- Proof-of-concept criteria

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF Technology Architecture guidance
- Cloud architecture reference architectures
- SABSA/Archimate alignment considerations

name: Risk, Security & Compliance Assessment
description:
Identify and assess security, privacy, regulatory, and operational risks associated with each technology option; map controls to standards and assess vendor risk.

Produce risk mitigation plans and residual risk posture, integrating findings into decision rationale and ongoing governance.

**Inputs**
- Regulatory requirements and privacy considerations
- Security policies and control baselines
- Architecture standards and risk appetite
- Vendor security posture and third-party risk information
- Data sensitivity and classification

**Outputs**
- Risk & compliance assessment report
- Mitigation actions and residual risk ratings
- Acceptance criteria and monitoring plan

**Stakeholders**
- Security & Compliance
- Privacy Office
- Legal
- IT
- Vendor Risk

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Threat modeling and risk assessment templates
- Security checklists and control catalogs

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- NIST Cybersecurity Framework
- ISO/IEC 27001 and SOC 2 considerations
- GDPR/CCPA where applicable

name: Cost & Financial Viability (TCO/ROI)
description:
Analyze total cost of ownership, operating costs, licensing, migration, and potential cost savings; compare scenarios and quantify ROI across options.

Provide a financial justification and funding guidance to inform prioritization and governance decisions.

**Inputs**
- Cost data (CAPEX and OPEX)
- Licensing and subscription models
- Migration and implementation costs
- Benefit assumptions and baseline financials
- Alternative scenarios and discount rates

**Outputs**
- TCO models and ROI estimates
- Cash-flow and sensitivity analyses
- Funding recommendations and business-case inputs

**Stakeholders**
- Finance
- PMO
- CIO Office
- Architecture
- Business Units
- Procurement

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Financial modeling templates
- Cost calculators and scenario tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- IT Financial Management (ITFM)
- COBIT for cost governance
- ITROI/Value realization principles

name: Vendor Evaluation & Selection
description:
Define evaluation criteria, assess vendor capabilities, conduct RFPs or proofs-of-concept, and compare options against both business and technical requirements.

Deliver a recommended vendor/tool shortlist with rationale, contract implications, and procurement guidance to enable informed choice.

**Inputs**
- Evaluation criteria and weightings
- Landscape shortlist and RFPs/proposals
- Legal and contract terms
- Security posture and compliance data
- Reference checks and demo results

**Outputs**
- Vendor shortlists and evaluation reports
- Recommendation memo and rationale
- Negotiation guidance and contract considerations

**Stakeholders**
- Procurement
- IT Sourcing
- Legal
- Architecture
- Business Units
- PMO

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Evaluation templates and scorecards
- Demonstration scripts
- Reference-check facilities

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- COBIT procurement governance
- ITIL sourcing practices
- TOGAF alignment considerations

name: Transition Planning & Integration
description:
Develop migration and integration plans to operationalize the selected technology; define sequencing, data migration, cutover, and change management activities.

Coordinate with Roadmap Development and Stakeholder Engagement to minimize disruption and ensure adoption and sustainability.

**Inputs**
- Target architecture and interoperability requirements
- Data migration needs and system dependencies
- Implementation roadmap and sequencing
- Change management considerations
- Security and operational readiness

**Outputs**
- Transition plan and migration sequencing
- Integration designs and interface specifications
- Cutover plan and rollback procedures
- Risk and dependency logs

**Stakeholders**
- PMO
- IT Operations
- Data/IT teams
- Security
- Business Units
- Change Management

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Project management and migration tooling
- Interface and data migration tooling

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- ITIL change management
- TOGAF Implementation & Migration
- COBIT implementation guidance

name: Benefits Realization & Measurement
description:
Define measurable benefits linked to business goals; establish KPIs, data sources, and a plan to monitor value realization throughout the lifecycle.

Track realized benefits, report results to governance bodies, and adjust investments to maximize ongoing value and continuous improvement.

**Inputs**
- Business goals and benefit hypotheses
- Baseline metrics and data sources
- Change in processes and capabilities
- Implementation milestones

**Outputs**
- Benefits realization plan
- Value metrics and dashboards
- Post-implementation review findings
- Lessons learned repository

**Stakeholders**
- Strategy & Innovation
- Finance
- PMO
- CIO Office
- Business Units

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- BRM (Benefits Realization Management) frameworks
- Value measurement dashboards

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- PMI BRM
- Value management guidelines
- IT program management best practices

name: Roadmap Strategy & Alignment
description:
Define and secure consensus on the strategic direction of the architecture roadmap, translating business objectives into a coherent plan of architectural initiatives that enable the organization to achieve its priorities.

Deliver an aligned, measurable roadmap that guides prioritization, funding, and execution, with clear success criteria and governance to ensure ongoing alignment with business goals.

**Inputs**
- Business strategy and objectives
- Current architecture roadmap and backlog
- Strategic themes and risk appetite
- Stakeholder requirements

**Outputs**
- Aligned roadmap with strategic rationale
- High-level initiative catalog and sequencing
- Success metrics and target milestones
- Approved governance approach

**Stakeholders**
- Enterprise Architecture Leadership
- Strategy and PMO
- Executive Sponsors
- Portfolio Managers

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Roadmapping tools (Aha!, Planview) and collaboration platforms

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF ADM alignment
- Alignment with enterprise architecture frameworks

name: Initiative Discovery & Value Proposition
description:
Capture and articulate candidate initiatives by identifying business value, strategic fit, feasibility, and alignment with target capabilities and operating models.

Produce a structured backlog with value hypotheses, initial scoping, and early success criteria to feed prioritization and roadmapping decisions.

**Inputs**
- Business problem statements
- Ideas from business units
- Capability target state definitions
- Market and regulatory signals

**Outputs**
- Initiative backlog items with value propositions
- Initial scoping and rough estimates
- Value hypotheses and success criteria

**Stakeholders**
- Business Owners
- Product Owners
- Capability Managers
- EA Portfolio Manager

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Idea capture tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- Alignment with SAFe Portfolio Kanban practices
- TOGAF-aligned backlog management

name: Prioritization & Sequencing Framework
description:
Apply a consistent prioritization model to rank initiatives by value, cost, risk, and strategic fit.

Produce a prioritized backlog and sequencing plan to guide delivery and funding decisions.

**Inputs**
- Initiative backlog
- Value estimates and readiness
- Dependencies and constraints
- Budget and capacity envelopes

**Outputs**
- Ranked backlog
- Sequencing plan and MVP candidates
- Rationale for prioritization decisions

**Stakeholders**
- Portfolio Management Office
- PMO
- Product Owners
- EA leads

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Scoring models
- Decision logs

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF and SAFe Portfolio management practices

name: Dependency & Constraint Mapping
description:
Identify and map inter-initiative dependencies, technology dependencies, and resource or regulatory constraints.

Produce a dependency map and constraint log to inform sequencing and risk mitigation.

**Inputs**
- Initiative relationships
- Technical dependencies
- Resource pools and skill assignments
- Regulatory constraints

**Outputs**
- Dependency map
- Constraint log
- Critical path view

**Stakeholders**
- Delivery Leads
- Architects
- PMO
- Resource Managers

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Diagramming and mapping tools (e.g., Archi, Miro)
- Portfolio management software

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- Alignment with project dependency management norms

name: Financial Alignment & Funding Planning
description:
Align roadmap with financial planning cycles by estimating cost, funding needs, and financial benefits.

Provide a funded roadmap with costed initiatives and ROI rationale.

**Inputs**
- Budget cycles and funding envelopes
- Cost estimates per initiative
- ROI expectations and payback periods
- Funding constraints

**Outputs**
- Funding plan
- Costed roadmap
- Financial visibility and variance tracking

**Stakeholders**
- Finance
- CFO
- PMO
- EA Lead

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Financial modeling tools
- Excel-based models

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- Alignment with IFRS/GAAP budgeting considerations

name: Timeline, Milestones & Release Cadence
description:
Define the timeline horizon, key milestones, and release cadence to synchronize delivery and expectations.

Provide a schedule that links prioritization, capacity, and dependencies to visible milestones and release windows.

**Inputs**
- Prioritized backlog
- Capacity constraints
- Dependencies
- Release criteria

**Outputs**
- Timeline with milestones
- Release schedule
- Milestone acceptance criteria

**Stakeholders**
- Delivery Leads
- Release Managers
- Product Owners
- QA

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Scheduling tools (Gantt, calendar integrators)
- Roadmap presentation tooling

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- Alignment with SAFe Release Train concepts

name: Resource Demand & Capacity Planning
description:
Forecast resource demand across the roadmap and compare against available capacity and skills.

Produce a resource plan and hiring/contracting plan to satisfy roadmap commitments.

**Inputs**
- Capacity data and sprint velocity
- Skill requirements and roles
- Staffing plans and contracts
- External capacity and vendors

**Outputs**
- Resource plan
- Hiring plan and talent gaps
- Capacity utilization forecasts

**Stakeholders**
- Resource Managers
- Human Resources
- Delivery Leads
- PMO

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- HRIS
- Capacity planning tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- None specific

name: Risk, Assumption & Mitigation Planning
description:
Identify risks and assumptions affecting the roadmap and define mitigation actions and triggers.

Provide a roadmap-level risk register and response plans to inform governance.

**Inputs**
- Risk registers from initiatives
- Assumptions and external threats
- Regulatory changes
- Historical project failure data

**Outputs**
- Roadmap risk register
- Mitigation plans
- Triggers and escalation paths

**Stakeholders**
- Risk Committee
- EA Risk Lead
- PMO
- Steering Committee

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Risk management tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- ISO 31000 risk management alignment

name: Governance, Change Control & Communication
description:
Establish governance and change-control processes to manage roadmap integrity and versioning.

Enable transparent communication of changes to stakeholders and maintain an auditable trail.

**Inputs**
- Change requests
- Governance policies and review minutes
- Current roadmap version

**Outputs**
- Change log
- Governance decisions
- Communicated updates

**Stakeholders**
- Steering Committee
- EA Governance
- Communications
- PMO

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Collaboration platforms
- Version control and dashboards

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF Governance alignment

name: Stakeholder Identification and Segmentation
description:
Identify and categorize all stakeholders affected by EA initiatives, based on interest, influence, impact, and decision rights, to enable targeted and efficient engagement.
This sub-capability delivers a living stakeholder register and segmentation model that informs engagement plans, governance participation, and change communications; success is measured by stakeholder coverage, engagement relevance, and timely feedback.

**Inputs**
- Strategic objectives and architecture roadmaps
- Current stakeholder list and contact data
- Organizational structure and governance bodies

**Outputs**
- Stakeholder register
- Stakeholder segmentation model
- Engagement plans for high-influence groups

**Stakeholders**
- Enterprise Architecture CoE
- Business unit leaders and sponsors
- PMO and program governance bodies
- Compliance and Risk teams

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Stakeholder management system (e.g., CRM) and EA repository
- Contact directory and governance portal

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- PMBOK Guide: Stakeholder Management
- TOGAF: Stakeholder Management
- ISO 31000: Risk Management

name: Stakeholder Engagement Planning and Governance
description:
Develop and maintain the engagement plan and governance model for architecture initiatives to guide who engages, when, and how decisions are made.
Outcomes include a formal engagement plan, governance charter, and defined decision rights; success is measured by plan adherence, forum attendance, and timely decisions.

**Inputs**
- Stakeholder register
- Architecture roadmap and program schedules
- Governance policies and charter

**Outputs**
- Engagement plan
- Governance charter
- Meeting calendars and decision logs

**Stakeholders**
- EA CoE
- Architecture governance bodies
- Steering committees
- Business and IT leadership

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Collaboration platforms, calendar/meeting management, governance portal

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- PMBOK Guide: Project Communications Management
- TOGAF: Stakeholder Management
- ISO 21500: Guidance on Project Management

name: Stakeholder Requirements Elicitation and Validation
description:
Capture, analyze, and validate stakeholder requirements for architecture artifacts and proposed changes to ensure alignment with business goals.
This sub-capability delivers a requirements catalog, validated backlog, and traceability that link decisions to stakeholder needs; success is measured by requirement coverage and stakeholder acceptance.

**Inputs**
- Business strategy, capability needs
- Current requirements from programs
- Architecture scenarios and principles

**Outputs**
- Requirements catalog
- Validated backlog
- Requirements traceability matrix

**Stakeholders**
- Business Product Owners
- Solution Architects and EA team
- Compliance and Risk
- QA/Testing

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Requirements management tool (e.g., JIRA, DOORS)

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- BABOK Guide: Requirements Elicitation and Validation
- TOGAF: Architecture Requirements

name: Stakeholder Communication and Collaboration Facilitation
description:
Plan and conduct communications and collaborative sessions (workshops, reviews, steering meetings) to ensure information flow, shared understanding, and coordinated action among stakeholders.
Outputs: meeting minutes, workshop summaries, collaboration artifacts; success metrics: attendance, participation, timely decisions.

**Inputs**
- Engagement plan, event agendas
- Current change requests
- Available collaboration channels

**Outputs**
- Meeting minutes
- Workshop summaries
- Collaboration artifacts (action logs)

**Stakeholders**
- EA CoE
- Steering committees, working groups
- Business and IT representatives
- Program/project teams

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Video conferencing, collaboration platforms, workshop facilitation tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- PMBOK Guide: Communications Management
- TOGAF: Stakeholder Engagement

name: Stakeholder Feedback, Issues and Risk Management
description:
Capture and triage stakeholder feedback, issues, and risks related to architecture initiatives; classify by severity and assign owners.
Outputs: issue log, risk register, action plans; success metrics: resolution time, closure rate, stakeholder satisfaction.

**Inputs**n- Feedback channels, issue escalation policies

**Outputs**
- Issue log
- Risk register
- Action plans

**Stakeholders**
- EA CoE
- Project teams
- Risk/compliance
- Sponsors

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Issue tracking system, risk management tool

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- ISO 31000
- PMBOK Risk Management

name: Stakeholder Relationship Management and Conflict Resolution
description:
Develop and sustain strategic relationships with key stakeholders; identify and address conflicts early to maintain alignment and trust across groups.
Outputs: stakeholder relationship maps, conflict resolution outcomes, escalation paths; success metrics: relationship health score, time-to-resolution for conflicts, and stakeholder retention.

**Inputs**
- Relationship history, governance structures
- Conflict logs, escalation policies

**Outputs**
- Stakeholder relationship map
- Conflict resolution outcomes
- Escalation pathways

**Stakeholders**
- EA CoE
- Executives, business unit leaders
- Program sponsors
- Compliance/Risk

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Stakeholder relationship portal or CRM
- Escalation management tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- PMBOK: Stakeholder Relationship Management
- TOGAF: Stakeholder Management

name: Stakeholder Benefits Realization and Sign-off
description:
Link architecture outcomes to stakeholder value propositions; track benefits realization and secure formal sign-off on architecture artifacts.
Outputs: benefits realization plan, sign-off records, KPI dashboards; success metrics: realized vs planned benefits, adoption rate, stakeholder satisfaction with outcomes.

**Inputs**
- Value case, performance metrics, business strategy
- Baseline metrics and targets

**Outputs**
- Benefits realization plan
- Sign-off records
- KPI dashboards

**Stakeholders**
- Business owners
- Steering committees
- Executives
- PMO

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Benefits tracking dashboards

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- PMBOK Benefits Realization
- TOGAF Value Realization

name: Maturity Model Definition and Maintenance
description:
Define and maintain the formal architecture maturity model used to measure and improve architectural practices across domains. Establish levels, criteria, and scoring to enable repeatable assessments and consistent comparisons over time.

Outcomes include a durable, auditable model aligned to strategic goals, clear guidance for assessments, and a foundation for prioritizing improvement actions.

**Inputs**
- Current maturity model and reference frameworks
- Scope of architectural practices to assess
- Governance policies and strategic objectives
- Assessment data sources and evidence

**Outputs**
- Documented maturity model with levels and criteria
- Maintenance plan and owner assignments
- Updated guidance for assessments and scoring

**Stakeholders**
- Enterprise Architecture CoE
- Architecture Practice Owners
- PMO and Strategy teams
- Compliance and Risk

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Architecture Repository and modeling tools
- Scoring engine or survey tooling

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF, CMMI, ISO/IEC 330XX (as applicable)

name: Baseline Assessment of Architectural Practices
description:
Execute a baseline assessment of current architectural practices to establish starting maturity across domains, teams, and artifacts. Gather evidence from interviews, artfacts, and existing process documentation to understand how architecture is practiced today.

Outcomes include a documented baseline, an evidence bank, and transparency for stakeholders to guide improvement and investment decisions.

**Inputs**
- Existing architectural practice inventories, catalogs, process descriptions
- Evidence from prior assessments, interviews, artifact reviews
- Scope and domains included in the baseline
- Stakeholder availability and data governance constraints

**Outputs**
- Baseline maturity report with domain scores
- Evidence pack and data quality notes
- Executive summary for decision-making

**Stakeholders**
- Architecture Practice Owners
- EA CoE
- PMO
- Compliance and Risk

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Architecture Repository, assessment templates, interview guides
- Survey and data collection tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF, CMMI, ITIL alignment notes

name: Target Maturity Definition and Goals
description:
Define target maturity levels per domain aligned to strategy, risk appetite, and regulatory context to articulate future-state expectations. Specify domain-specific success criteria and alignment with strategic priorities.

Outcomes include domain-by-domain targets, prioritization criteria, and a plan for achieving desired maturity within budget and time constraints.

**Inputs**
- Strategic plan, risk appetite, regulatory requirements
- Baseline results and stakeholder expectations
- Resource and capability constraints

**Outputs**
- Target maturity levels by domain
- Domain-specific success criteria
- High-level transition plan

**Stakeholders**
- Strategy and EA Leadership
- Portfolio Management
- Risk and Compliance

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Strategy planning and roadmapping tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF ADM alignment; reference to relevant maturity models

name: Gap Analysis and Improvement Backlog
description:
Identify maturity gaps between baseline and target across domains, processes, and capabilities. Translate gaps into concrete, prioritized improvement initiatives and backlog items.

Outcomes include a prioritized backlog of improvement initiatives with owners, estimates, and sequencing to drive progressive maturity.

**Inputs**
- Baseline maturity, Target maturity, evidence
- Domain-specific gaps and risk indicators
- Resource constraints and dependencies

**Outputs**
- Gap analyses per domain
- Prioritized improvement backlog with owners, estimates, and sequencing
- Alignment of backlogs to strategic goals

**Stakeholders**
- Architecture Teams
- PMO
- Change Management

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Backlog management tool (e.g., Jira/Clarity)
- Prioritization and value/effort analysis tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF, ITIL alignment; value-based analysis approaches

name: Maturity Metrics, Scoring and Dashboards
description:
Develop and maintain metrics, scoring rules, and dashboards to track maturity trends and evidence-based progress. Establish thresholds and cadence for reporting to business and technology leadership.

Outcomes include objective performance visibility for executives, architecture teams, and program managers, enabling data-driven decisions.

**Inputs**
- Assessment results, scoring criteria, evidence of progress
- Organizational reporting needs and cadence
- Data sources and quality indicators

**Outputs**
- Maturity scorecards and dashboards
- Trend reports and executive view documents
- Actionable insights for continuous improvement

**Stakeholders**
- Exec Sponsors
- Architecture Governance Body
- Portfolio Management

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- BI tools and dashboards
- Data warehouse or data lake for measurement data

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF and performance measurement references; SFIA alignment considerations

name: Evidence Collection and Verification
description:
Capture and verify objective evidence to support maturity assessments, including artifacts, interviews, demonstrations, and tool outputs. Ensure traceability and data quality for trustworthy results.

Outcomes include a credible audit trail, reproducible results, and reduced assessment risk from data quality issues.

**Inputs**
- Assessment data, artifact samples, system evidence
- Data sources and interview notes
- Provenance and version history requirements

**Outputs**
- Verified evidence pack
- Audit trail and data quality notes
- Validation report and approver sign-off

**Stakeholders**
- Data Owners
- QA and Compliance
- Architecture Assessors

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Version control, document management, data quality tooling

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- Audit and evidence standards; relevant regulatory expectations

name: Remediation Planning and Implementation Support
description:
Convert gaps into actionable remediation plans with owners, budgets, timelines, and dependencies. Align with program and change-management workflows to enable effective execution.

Outcomes include funded, scheduled actions integrated with project portfolios, delivering measurable maturity gains over time.

**Inputs**
- Gap backlog, budgets, resources, dependencies
- Portfolio and project plans
- Change-management constraints

**Outputs**
- Remediation plan with owners, timelines, and dependencies
- Resource and budget alignment
- Status and progress updates

**Stakeholders**
- Change Management
- Project Managers
- Finance and Portfolio Officers

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- PM tools, dependency tracking and tracking dashboards

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- PMBOK alignment; TOGAF-based implementation guidance

name: Governance, Policy Alignment and Compliance Monitoring
description:
Assess how architectural maturity aligns with governance standards, policies, and regulatory requirements to ensure sustainable practices. Map maturity improvements to policy controls and risk mitigations.

Outcomes include compliance mapping, policy alignment evidence, and ongoing assurance that maturity improvements remain within risk appetite.

**Inputs**
- Governance standards, policies, regulatory requirements
- Existing controls and risk mappings
- Maturity improvement plans

**Outputs**
- Compliance mapping and policy alignment reports
- Policy control coverage gaps and remediation notes
- Compliance dashboards for leadership

**Stakeholders**
- Governance Bodies
- Architecture Team
- Compliance and Risk

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Policy management and governance dashboards

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- TOGAF, COBIT, ISO/IEC 27001 alignment considerations

name: Competency Development and Training Alignment
description:
Identify skill gaps and align competency development with maturity ambitions, roles, and career pathways for architects. Integrate learning with practical maturity initiatives.

Outcomes include targeted training plans, role-based development, and measurable increases in architectural capability.

**Inputs**
- Skill gaps, competency framework, roles
- Training catalogs and delivery capacities
- Individual development plans

**Outputs**
- Training plan and schedule
- Competency matrix and progress tracking
- Certification or validation records

**Stakeholders**
- HR/L&D
- Architecture Managers
- Individuals and teams

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- LMS and skills assessment tools

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- SFIA, job-role frameworks; continuing professional development standards

name: Data and Tooling Readiness for Maturity Measurement
description:
Assess data availability, quality, and tooling readiness required to measure and manage maturity across domains. Ensure data lineage, governance, and tooling enable accurate measurement.

Outcomes include data integration plan, data quality improvements, and a plan to acquire or configure enabling tools.

**Inputs**
- Data sources inventory, data quality assessment, tool landscape
- Data governance policies
- Measurement data requirements

**Outputs**
- Data integration plan and data model for maturity data
- Data quality improvement actions and owners
- Tooling requirements and procurement/implementation plan

**Stakeholders**
- Data Governance
- IT Operations
- Architecture Team

**Enabling Technologies and Tools**
- Data integration platforms, architecture repository integrations, measurement tooling

**Alignment with Industry Standards and Frameworks**
- DAMA-DMBOK, COBIT data governance guidance
